decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Daze. The deck also utilizes cards like Brazen Borrower and Gurmag Angler to maintain board control. It aims to pressure the opponent quickly and efficiently, while also being able to protect its threats with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The mana base includes Wasteland and fetch lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

This Control - Stoneblade deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland to keep opponents in check. By leveraging card advantage from cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, the goal is to control the pace of the game and ultimately win through a combination of creature beats and equipment advantages.

This legacy deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the board. It includes powerful and versatile cards like Delver of Secrets, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Dark Confidant. The deck also incorporates disruptive spells like Force of Will, Abrupt Decay, and Thoughtseize. By controlling the game early with countermagic and removal spells, the deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is designed to support casting spells of various colors efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By leveraging cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Crystalline Giant, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst provides additional disruption against opposing spells, while cards like Umori, the Collector and Vault Skirge offer versatility and resilience. The deck's mana base and artifact synergies enable it to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Control deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Brainstorm for card advantage and Monastery Mentor for additional threats. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the board through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. Using powerful Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope, along with disruptive creatures like Baleful Strix and Hullbreacher, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It also utilizes a mix of discard spells, such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Hymn to Tourach, to strip away key cards from the opponent's hand. With a versatile spell suite and a strong mana base, Grixis Control aims to outmaneuver and outlast its opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing countermagic, card draw, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for powerful late-game plays like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. The deck aims to consistently control the board through cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares while generating card advantage through Ponder, Brainstorm, and Predict. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the potential of Mystic Sanctuary for recurring key spells.

The main idea of this Legacy Show and Tell combo deck is to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using Show and Tell or Sneak Attack. The deck includes various cantrips and counterspells to help dig for combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption. With the ability to quickly put out massive threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a defense. Additional ramp options like Lotus Petal and fast lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors help accelerate the deck's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play spells to trigger the abilities of Arclight Phoenix, Delver of Secrets, and Sprite Dragon. By running a high density of cantrips and cheap spells, the deck aims to consistently have a fast start and control the game through tempo plays with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck utilizes powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and close out games. The mana base is streamlined to maximize efficiency and consistency in casting spells.

The deck aims to use the Show and Tell combo to cheat powerful cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play early. Teferi, Time Raveler and Venser, Shaper Savant provide disruption against opponents, while cards like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm ensure consistency in drawing into combo pieces. Cunning Wish gives additional flexibility in grabbing the right answer from the sideboard. Force of Will provides protection for the combo, and cards like Omniscience allow for explosive plays. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly assembling its combo pieces to overwhelm opponents.

The key concept of this deck revolves around using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Sprite Dragon to quickly apply pressure to the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells and card selection cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to close out the game quickly. The mana base is focused on fetching for dual lands to ensure consistent access to both red and blue mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Bomberman combo, using Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana and draw through the deck with Ranger of Eos and Walking Ballista. Karn, the Great Creator and Spatial Contortion provide removal and disruption while the ramp package with Cloudpost and Glimmerpost help accelerate the combo. Chalice of the Void is used to slow down opponent's game plan and Thought-Knot Seer gives additional disruption. The companion, Gyruda, Doom of Depths, adds an extra layer of threat and card advantage to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Exhume, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. The deck focuses on using cards like Entomb to put key creatures like Griselbrand or Archon of Valor's Reach into the graveyard, then using spells like Dark Ritual to quickly put them back into play. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Unmask to protect its game plan and ensure the combo can go off successfully.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to slow down the opponent, while using Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic to remove threats and search for powerful equipment. The deck also has a solid mana denial strategy with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland, making it difficult for the opponent to develop their board. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds additional value and flexibility to the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as a resource to control the opponent's board while ramping up to powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Titania, Protector of Argoth. It also includes disruption in the form of Gaddock Teeg and Reclamation Sage to handle problematic spells or permanents. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of land destruction, creature ramp, and efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. By efficiently managing resources and exploiting lands, it seeks to establish a dominant board presence and grind out victories over time.

This deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer quickly with the help of mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void to hinder the opponent's game plan. Aggressively applying pressure with cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Punishing Fire, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own strategy. The inclusion of cards like Blood Sun and City of Traitors further enhances the deck's explosiveness and efficiency.
